node.title: Ukraine Says Russia Sending Snipers, Tanks to Border to 'Provoke Return Fire' From Its Troops
node.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Joe Biden are expected to discuss Ukraine tensions during a high-stakes video call Tuesday.

node.title: Share of Wealth Held by 10 Percent of World's Richest Hits Historic Levels Amid Pandemic
node.description: "Global inequalities seem to be about as great today as they were at the peak of Western imperialism in the early 20th century," said the World Inequality Report.

node.title: Man Leaves Note Saying He Killed Wife, Kids After Vaccine Card Forgery Exposed
node.description: The German prosecutor said the note was discovered in the house where the bodies of two adults and three children had been found.

node.title: Whistleblower Says U.K. Forces Evacuated Shelter Animals Rather Than Helping Afghans Leave
node.description: Raphael Marshall claimed that nearly 200 cats and dogs were flown out of Afghanistan and that British soldiers were put at risk to evacuate the animals.

node.title: Facial Scanning Tech Spots Woman Using Sister's Passport, COVID Vaccine Card to Cross U.S.-Canada Border
node.description: According to Customs and Border Protection, since 2018 over "1,100 impostors" have been detected by facial scanning technology at ports of entry into the U.S.

node.title: Former CDC Director Tom Frieden Warns Of 'Hard Winter' as Omicron Ravages U.S.
node.description: Dr. Tom Frieden said every adult in America should be offered the booster jab to help protect the country from the virus.

node.title: Texas Using Boats Lined Up on Rio Grande to Stop Flow of Migrants
node.description: The measure is a part of Operation Lone Star, which Governor Greg Abbott's office states is aimed to combat the "smuggling of people and drugs into Texas."

node.title: De Blasio Explains NYC Vaccine Mandate for Kids, 'Give Parents A Sense of Urgency' Amid Omicron
node.description: "We're dealing with a new reality—this is not the fall. This is the winter," De Blasio warned parents.

node.title: Donald Trump and Bill O'Reilly's History Tour Has Thousands of Tickets Unsold
node.description: No venue is close to being at capacity just days before the tour begins in Florida.

node.title: Unvaccinated Mother Dies From COVID After Giving Birth to Fourth Child
node.description: The woman was not vaccinated, the Milwaukee County Medical Examiner's Office told a local TV station.

node.title: Accused Capitol Rioters Could Spend More Than a Year in Jail Before Trial
node.description: Judge Amit Mehta, who is overseeing several cases, expressed some hesitation about delays in bringing the defendants to trial.

node.title: Apple AirTags Are Being Used by Car Thieves to Track High-End Vehicles
node.description: A police department recently warned residents about the new car theft trend, advising them to regularly inspect their vehicles for "any suspicious potential tracking devices."

node.title: Five test positive to COVID-19 after boat cruise on Sydney Harbour, concerns two are Omicron variant
node.description: NSW Health is urgently contacting around 140 people who were on the boat and directing them and members of their households to immediately get tested, isolate and await further public advice.

node.title: Chris Cuomo drops SiriusXM show after being fired from CNN
node.description: Former anchor faces claims after being fired for trying to help older brother, former NY Governor Andrew Cuomo, deal with harassment allegations.

node.title: A Monument to the Lives of Black Women and Girls
node.description: “The Black Girlhood Altar” began as a community project fueled by collective grief. Now it’s on display at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago.

node.title: Cloud Seeding Explained As China Reportedly Controlled Weather Before Political Parade
node.description: China's government has invested well over a billion dollars into weather control technology, the Xinhua news agency reported in 2017.

node.title: Norwegian Wolves Are Extinct, With No Genetic Trace Left Behind
node.description: Scientists confirm the wolf population that roamed Norway and Sweden for around 12,000 years was wiped out by humans.

node.title: Mark Meadows Walks Back on Deposition Agreement With Jan. 6 Committee
node.description: This latest development comes just a week after the House panel had announced the former White House chief of staff's cooperation.

node.title: China's Diplomat to Russia Calls U.S. Olympic Boycott a 'Senseless Desecration'
node.description: The Biden administration says it will not send any diplomatic or official representation to the Beijing Winter Olympics.

node.title: UAE moving official workweek to Monday through Friday
node.description: Government employees would work a half-day on Friday, the traditional Muslim holy day, and then take Saturday and Sunday off.

node.title: Cop Kills Wife, Five Others in Shooting Spree: Police
node.description: Kenyan police said the officer, identified as Police Constable Benson Imbasi, went on a "killing spree" near the capital Nairobi before taking his own life.

node.title: China Threatens To Derail Joint Climate Action Over U.S. Olympics Boycott
node.description: The White House said China's cooperation on global issues such as climate change "is not a favor" to the United States.

node.title: Kansas Police Spend Entire Day Chasing Camel Who Escaped From Live Nativity
node.description: Law enforcement tried to catch the dashing dromedary—branded "Forrest Hump" by local residents—using golf carts and a lasso.

node.title: Ethiopia Says It Recaptured Strategic Towns from Rebels
node.description: The government said it took back the towns of Dessie and Kombolcha, the latest in a string of wins Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has claimed in recent days.

node.title: "Omicron" and "Eilish" among 2021's most mispronounced words
node.description: The list identifies words that proved most challenging for newsreaders and people on television to pronounce this year.

node.title: Why THAT Fake Donald Trump Christmas Card Has Gone Viral
node.description: The fabricated Christmas card featuring an image of the former president in a tuxedo was trending on Twitter before users realized it was not real.

node.title: Highlights From the 4 Heisman Finalists
node.description: College football’s top individual honor will go to Bryce Young, C.J. Stroud, Kenny Pickett or Aidan Hutchinson. See them in action.

node.title: Seeking Space for Solar Farms, Cities Find Room at Their Airports
node.description: Airports around the nation are installing solar arrays on unused land, roofs and parking garages, helping them achieve self-sufficiency while also providing power to their communities.

node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

node.title: Biden to warn Putin Russia will face toughest sanctions yet if Kremlin invades Ukraine
node.description: In a meeting with his Russian counterpart, Joe Biden will warn Vladimir Putin against using tens of thousands of troops massed near its border to attack Ukraine.
